data.title: Great library.
data.text: This is an excellent library which I often frequent.The staff are so knowledgable.They are most helpful.There are always lovely comfortable seats and quiet areas.Just what you'd expect from a library.I enjoy going here.

data.title: A Fine Place to Do Research
data.text: As a media historian, I always love libraries, and this is one of the good ones. The Cambridge Public Library is a wonderful blend of old and new, and a popular venue for local meetings and events (Cambridge Community Television has taped some educational programs here).  In addition to a large collection of books and journals, what I like about this library is its genealogical resources:  there are both digital and microfilm versions of a number of old Cambridge newspapers, many of which are difficult to find elsewhere; the Cambridge Room contains a fine collection of local history resources (old books, maps, photographs, etc) and other rare archival materials.  The reference staff is very knowledgeable, and eager to answer researchers' questions. I'm very impressed with the Cambridge Public Library, and if local history is your interest, you will be impressed too!

data.title: Excellent place
data.text: This library offers a great collection of books, comics, films, music... Also it’s a really good place to relax and enjoy. It has a nice patio and also indoor places to seat comfortably. Plus, it’s situated just in the middle of a nice park that you can enjoy, specially with kids.

data.title: Beautiful library with something for everyone
data.text: This is a beautiful library that has successfully blended a gorgeous old building with a modern and light-filled addition.  There is a large children's area, active teen room and a lovely wood paneled reading room.

data.title: Great space
data.text: I confess, I came to the library looking for a place to do some work, rather than check out a book. As a work space, it's great - the new building is light and airy, with good wifi and plenty of electrical outlets.

data.title: Great historic Building/
data.text: You will never find a nicer place to take pictures of a library. They do not make them like this any more.

data.title: One of the best libraries around
data.text: This place got a major face lift a few years back and is one of the gems of the Cambridge - not to mention the numerous other small locations, making it very easy for locals to access library resources. The main library is located right next to the city's high school and right outside Harvard Square. It is a beautiful glass facade that looks out onto a lovely green space that is full of people in the Spring/Summer. It's got top-notch resources and lots of helpful programs like museum passes and discounts for tourist attractions.  A gem in Cambridge for all.

data.title: The Best
data.text: Great architecture, the main part of this Library was done by Richardson I believe. They added a contemporary piece which fits right in. Great staff, and peaceful interior. Generally they have what you are looking for or they will find it for you. Landscaping is super. Many people hang out on the lawn in front or children are at the playground. Love this place.

data.title: great library
data.text:
good size library near Harvard and the high school.
Lots of events happen there.  nice children's room.  
Have noticed that some famous authors sometimes appear there.
the whole system has many children friendly events.

data.title: The Crown Jewel of Cambridge's Public Library System
data.text:
I'd visit just to see the architecture! This library is filled with natural light, and has 30 foot walls of glass on the first floor. It was extensively renovated back in 2009, and doesn't feel at all like it's actually over 100 years old. 

Even if you're not looking for a book, it can be a great place to work: there's a teen area for hanging out (which I've only dropped in on) and my young daughter loves visiting the top floor: it's entirely dedicated to kids. In nicer weather you can picnic and relax on the front lawn.

If you *are* looking for a book their collection is extensive and if you don't know what you've want they do a good job at putting out books to catch your eye.

It might not be clear from the outside-- but they've got an underground garage that makes parking a snap. It costs $1 an hour. This is a real boon giving the normally hard-to-park-in-neighborhoods.

data.title: Beautifully updated landmark
data.text: This ever impressive building has gone through a major renovation and large expansion. The new wing is elegant -glass unfolding and floating over a meadow. The library owns extensive collections and collaborates with all greater area institutions, including the august Harvard Widener Library, just a few steps away in the Harvard Yard. A walk in this area can easily lead to a visit across the street at the Harvard Museums, also newly renovated with the wonderful work of Italian architect Renzo Piano.

data.title: Reading adventure
data.text: Modern, well organized library with plenty of browsing spaces and lots of new books to explore.  Very helpful, friendly staff.  And the price is right!

data.title: Beautiful space
data.text: This is a great place to hang out on a hot day in the summer or a cold day in the winter.  There is a wall of windows with comfy chairs where you can sit, check your email, or read one of the many, many books.

data.title: Great addition to the city
data.text: A wonderful (relatively) new library. Enormous children's section (entire third floor) friendly, helpful staff, large collection of books, music, and videos, and very comfortable places to read or study, or eat!. Parking in building ($1/hr). Very good community resource.

data.title: afternoon on the green
data.text: lovely green quad outside this library, across the street from our B&B. Folks gather there all the time...to watch the eclipse last nite too!  on the weekends its family play, the tennis courts are active, the dogs are running around. great place

user_location.name: new york city & palm beach gardens Fl

data.title: This place was stunning inside! Very homelike feel!
data.text: I was only here for a brief time, and had walked for an hour to get there from the Garment District! As a tourist, it was worth it! Great photo opportunities! Very inviting and warm atmosphere! Would be a great study place for students of all ages!

data.title: Great library for children and helpful staff
data.text: This library is amazing! Not only it sits in a nice  green area with parks but it is 5 min walking distance from Harvard University. It has a third level floor filled with children's books and area for seating and reading that is child friendly! It is also very rich with resources and the staff is very helpful!

data.title: BEST library EVER
data.text: The BEST library ever!  This library is for everyone.  Downstairs you can meet with friends, colleagues or associates, eat food, read magazines or books, use computers, talk in general. The second floor is quiet and you can only have water.  There is even a room where you can read.  There are also closed tiny meeting rooms for 2 or 3 people that you can sign up for.  The third floor is for kids...it is cheerful, fun and just for kids and parents.  On the first floor in the old section there is a teen room with beanbag chairs and a wonderful person to help and old fashioned booths.  My kids love it.  I love it all.

data.title: Comfy place to chill
data.text: A few minutes' walk from Harvard Square, a lovely, spacious, comfortable place to spend some time.  Has an outdoor lounging room and several comfy indoor rooms.  HOWEVER, be aware that if you are not a Massachusetts resident, you cannot use the library's public computers.  I wanted to have a break and play online chess, but since I am not a MA resident I was turned away.

data.title: Best Place to Browse and Study
data.text: As a resident Cantabrigian, I spend a lot of time here. It's is a lovely place to hang-out, either inside or outside. Outside the wide grassy areas invite folks to bring a blanket and picnic, or read, or watch folks come and go. The library itself is beautiful with plenty of places to read and study, a huge DVD selection and a state-of-the-art theater. Look for their schedule of events for adults, teens and children (parents will love this section too). The Cambridge Public Library has much to offer residents and visitors.
